page.title: 08Infants Outing from Wimbish
page.content: On July 2nd all the infant children in classes 2 and 3 went on their school outing to Hayes Hill Farm, Lee Valley Park, near Nazeing in Essex. The children particularly enjoyed looking at the donkeys, goats and bulls. They could pick up the baby rabbits and stroke them, and there was a baby lamb which was only a few days old. The children enjoyed touching the sheep because of their woolly coats, and the pigs because of their sheer size. The picnic in the field was fun and the children made friends with Indian children from a London school sitting next to us in the field. The children were fascinated by the milking of the cows and the processes the milk went through. The highlight of one boy's day was seeing an artist painting in the field as we returned home on the coach.
